intro: Reichardia picroides subsp. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate stinkcup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its alternate, pinnately compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and along streambanks. Reichardia picroides subsp. intermedia is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is released when the leaves are crushed.
